DOC.brief_summary: Rheumatoid arthritis ( RA ) chronic illness . Patients RA often experience significant pain depression . This study evaluate two program design improve symptom RA : cognitive-behavioral therapy ( CBT ) Tai Chi Chih ( TCC ) , compare health education seminar .
DOC.brief_title: Cognitive-Behavioral Therapy Tai Chi Chih Patients With Rheumatoid Arthritis
DOC.detailed_description: Rheumatoid arthritis progressive inflammatory illness mark severe functional decline , significant economic social cost , significant psychological distress . Environmental psychosocial factor stress , mood disturbance , cop mechanism may contribute change important health outcome , include disability disease activity RA . This study compare CBT TCC , relaxation-based intervention , combine element slow gentle movement meditation , traditional health education seminar . Outcome measure include psychological adaptation , mood disturbance , sleep quality , physiological adaptation , disease severity . Two hundred-ten patient randomly assign either CBT , TCC , control group . The CBT intervention three phase : 1 ) education nature adjustment process chronic illness , 2 ) cop skill development , 3 ) generalization application skill everyday situation . Participants CBT group attend 12 weekly group session 2 hour . Participants TCC group learn perform 18 movement guidance expert TCC teacher . TCC participants 50 60 minute biweekly session 12-week study . Control group participant attend weekly group educational session ; session provide general knowledge arthritis health illness , include lecture , demonstration , question-and-answer session expert rheumatology , sleep science , behavioral medicine . Participants assess prior beginning treatment , mid-treatment ( Week 6 ) end treatment ( Week 12 13 ) . The long term effect intervention assess follow-up interview 4 month 8 month end formal treatment . Psychosocial adaptation , mood disturbance sleep quality , self-reported pain , immune function measure five assessment period .
